metadata.title: CVE-2018-20852 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
http.cookiejar.DefaultPolicy.domain_return_ok in Lib/http/cookiejar.py inPython before 3.7.3 does not correctly validate the domain: it can betricked into sending existing cookies to the wrong server. An attacker mayabuse this flaw by using a server with a hostname that has another validhostname as a suffix (e.g., pythonicexample.com to steal cookies forexample.com). When a program uses http.cookiejar.DefaultPolicy and tries todo an HTTP connection to an attacker-controlled server, existing cookiescan be leaked to the attacker. This affects 2.x through 2.7.16, 3.x before3.4.10, 3.5.x before 3.5.7, 3.6.x before 3.6.9, and 3.7.x before 3.7.3.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20852` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
libpython2.7 - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
python2.7 - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
python2.7-examples - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1
No subscription required

idle-python3.6 - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
libpython3.6 - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
libpython3.6-minimal - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
libpython3.6-stdlib - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
libpython3.6-testsuite - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
python3.6 - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
python3.6-examples - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
python3.6-minimal - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
python3.6-venv - 3.6.8-1~18.04.2
No subscription required

idle-python3.7 - 3.7.3-2
libpython3.7 - 3.7.3-2
libpython3.7-minimal - 3.7.3-2
libpython3.7-stdlib - 3.7.3-2
libpython3.7-testsuite - 3.7.3-2
python3.7 - 3.7.3-2
python3.7-examples - 3.7.3-2
python3.7-minimal - 3.7.3-2
python3.7-venv - 3.7.3-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.15-4ubuntu4~18.04.1').
python3.6 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.8-1~18.04.2').
python3.7 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.7.3-2').
